Name: Hope Centre (The)
Description (Service): The Food Bank provides supplementary groceries, including fresh fruits, vegetables and dairy products, (when available) to registered members once per month. Anyone can visit the food bank weekly for items that have a shorter shelf life - breads and produce. Supply will depend on the donated products that are received.
Hours: Mon-Fri 9:30 am-11:45 am, 12:30 pm-3 pm
Application: Our food bank is available to residents of Welland who have a low income.  Clients need to present ID for all members of the family accessing the food bank; proof of income and proof of address at each visit.  Clients can come once every 30 days to our food bank.
Primary Contact: Gina Couldery, Food Security Coordinator; Phone: 905-788-0744 ext 231
Volunteer Coordinator: Nancy Hart, Volunteer Coordinator; Phone: 905-788-0744 ext 227
Address: 570 King StWelland, ON     L3B 3L2 View Google Map
Print Material: Brochures, flyers, posters, AGM report, postcards

Name: Newark Neighbours
Description (Service): A completely volunteer operated organization that assists people in need by providing assistance with food and clothing. Also operates a thrift store where clothing is available to anyone at a low cost. Items in the thrift shop include men's, women's and children's clothing, household items, small applicances, linens, books, toys and games.  Food baskets for needy residents are provided at Easter, Thanksgiving and Christmas. Christmas gifts are also given to children of families receiving baskets at Christmas.
Hours: Food Bank and Thrift Store  Mon, Tue, Thu, Fri 9:30 am-2 pm *  Thrift Store only Sun 9:30 am-2 pm May-Aug
Application: Call for appointment or walk in during Food Bank Hours.  Must provide proof of residence and proof of income.
Primary Contact: Bonnie Turner
Address: 310 John St ENiagara-on-the-Lake, ON     L0S 1J0 View Google Map
Intersection: John St E and the Parkway (located at the last driveway on John St E before the Parkway)
Mailing Address: PO Box 1090 Ste 150 Niagara-on-the-Lake, ON     L0S 1J0
Accessibility: Partially Accessible - Parking - Accessible; Entrance - Accessible; Washroom - Not Accessible

Name: Port Cares
Description (Service): The Reach Our Food Centre provides tangible support and assistance to residents in Port Colborne and Surrounding area.   Community Meal Programs: A nutritious, hot meal served 4 days per week Community Garden: Learn to grow fresh, inexpensive and nutritious vegetables Choose Your Own Adventure: Fun, free activities and homework help for youth age 8-14 after school Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays during the school year (3:30-5:30) Health Programs: Ever-changing community health classes such as cooking circles (call for info. about current programming) Information and referral: Staff will provide assistance with navigating services Lunch Kits: Weekly lunch supplies for elementary school children (incl. bread, meat, snacks etc.)
Hours: Food Banks: Mon, Wed, Thu 12:30 pm-3:30 pm Meal program: Mon, Wed 12 noon * Thu 4 pm * Sun 9 am (call before to confirm Sun program)
Areas Served: Port Colborne - and surrounding area ; Wainfleet
Eligibility: Food Bank: Individuals and families from Port Colborne with low-income or in need Choose Your Own Adventure: Youth aged 8-14 All other programs: No restrictions, open to the community
Application: Clients need to provide proof of residence, income and dependents and photo identification for the food bank.
Primary Contact: Amanda Upper, Site Supervisor, Port Cares Reach Out Centre; Phone: 905-835-1914 ext 22; Email: Amanda.Upper@portcares.ca

Name: Community Care, St Catharines and Thorold
Description (Service): Distributes food, good used clothing (including winter clothing), small household articles to residents facing financial challenges  Emergency Medical/Dental Vision care assistance available on case by case basis dependant on available funds. (dental cleaning/scaling not applicable)   The Christmas Bureau provides new toys (age specific) and grocery vouchers. Life Skills training includes Savoury Samplings Program & Community Gardens. Back to School Snacks & Sneakers program in late August (backpacks and school supplies while supplies  last)  Shelter issues are addressed through Community Care's Housing Help Program.  Trusteeships are provided to those experiencing money management issues. Assistance with replacing ID for registered clients is now available through the housing program.   Community Care is pleased to administer the Canadian Tire Jumpstart program for St Catharines residents. Jumpstart provides financially disadvantaged children, aged 4-18 years, with the opportunity to participate in sports and recreational activities. Call 905-685-1349 ext 228 for more information.
Hours: Client Services Mon-Thu 9 am-3 pm, Fri 9 am-12 noon * Office Mon-Fri 9 am-4:30 pm * Office Mon-Fri 9 am-4 pm, Sep-Jun
Eligibility: All, with low income or demonstrated need
Application: Proper personal ID required, proof of address and proof of income required to register for services and programs.
Languages: English ; Translations in other languages available
Events: Pennies for Community Care: We continue to collect pennies to help with food purchases. Pennies can be dropped off  at both St. Catharines & Thorold locations. Visit Community Care website at www.communitycarestca.ca for events.  Harvest Days - Aug/Sep; Raise the Roof  Campaign (Toque Tuesday) - Feb; Easter Egg Hunt - March/April - Tax Clinics, April; Food Drives - May, Sep. Call the office or visit the website for more information.
Primary Contact: Eden Ewert, Volunteer Coordinator; Phone: 905-685-1349 ext 225; Email: eewert@communitycarestca.ca
Address: 12 North StSt Catharines, ON     L2R 6W8 View Google Map
Intersection: North St off of Court St
Mailing Address: PO Box 575 St Catharines, ON     L2R 6W8
Funding: Donations - Corporate and Private ; United Way - St Catharines

Description (Service): Available to residents facing financial challenges or in emergency situations: * Food * Good used clothing * Small household articles   Assistance for emergency prescription expenses, dental (cleaning/scaling not covered) and vision care contingent upon available funds * assistance is provided on a limited case by case basis when funds are available   Christmas program provides new toys and grocery voucher
Hours: Donation Drop Off Mon-Fri 8 am-4 pm * Client Services Mon-Fri 9 am-11 am, 1 pm-3 pm * Thrift Shop Mon-Fri 9 am-3:30 pm, Sat 10 am-2 pm
Eligibility: All, with low income or demonstrated need
Application: Required to register for services and programs: * Personal Identification * Proof of address * Proof of income
Events: Call the office or visit the website for information on how to help.

Name: Pelham Cares Inc.
Public Comments: Services offered to residents of Pelham. Residents asking for Food or Youth Subsidy assistance, must be screened for eligibility (i.e. residency and low income)
Description (Service): Provides transportation to medical appointments; maintains a food bank to provide food assistance; sponsors child/youth (Birth-18 yrs)  for sport and recreational activities; assistance to families who suffer loss due to fire or other catastrophes and occasional; short-term emergency accommodation. Referral to other agencies if unable to assist.
Hours: Mon-Fri 8:30 am-12 noon, after hours by appointment only
Primary Contact: Lori Grande, Coordinator, Client Services
Address: 191 RR 20 EFonthill, ON     L0S 1E0 View Google Map
Funding: Donations ; Food and Monetary donations are welcome and appreciated
Meetings: Board meetings held monthly every 3rd Tue, no meetings in Jul & Aug

Name: Life Together Church
Description (Service): Christian church serving the Niagara region with a variety of programs.   Sunday Service and free hot lunch. All are welcome.  Community Connections Food Program: Community Connections Time with free juice and snacks. Groceries handed out following Community Connections Time. All are welcome.   Donations: Welcoming donations for non-perishable food items for community food program.
Hours: Sunday services 10:30 am with lunch around 12:30 pm (no defined time) Community Connections Time: Wed 4:30 pm Community Connections Food Program: Wed 6 pm-7 pm

Address: 202 Pelham RdSt Catharines, ON     L2S 1W7

Name: Project SHARE
Description (Service): Provides emergency assistance to individuals and their families in Niagara Falls whose income is under the poverty line.  SUPPORT: volunteer work experience is available to develop existing skills, extension of personal networks, goal setting and advocacy. HOUSING: offers assistance with housing searches. Maintains housing listings, offers advocacy and provides referrals for landlord/tenant legal issues. Also, has Niagara Regional Housing applications.  AWARENESS: offers public education to enhance community awareness of poverty in Niagara Falls and direct client service to enable members to utilize services available to assist them. RESOURCES: partners with other agencies to ensure families have clothing and baby supplies. EMERGENCY: assistance and referrals for residents of Niagara Falls for food, food vouchers, transportation, some prescription drugs (ie antibiotics), glasses and utilities is provided. Limited dental assistance program available. Call for details. UTILITY SUBSIDY PROGRAM(funded by United Way of Niagara Falls, NPEI, Regional Niagara): Should those in need in Niagara Falls receive a disconnection notice from a utility (gas/water/hydro) they can apply to see if they qualify for a subsidy to pay the reconnection fee.  CHRISTMAS PROGRAM: To sponsor a needy family at Christmas. Contact Pat Inneo, Christmas Coordinator. COMMUNITY GARDEN: People can grow nutritious produce in their own garden plots, from seeds and plants donated by local businesses.  Local children are taught to plan and plant their own community gardens at local schools and community organizations. EMPOWERING PARTNERSHIPS PROGRAM: Heart healthy nutritious recipes are provided to families in workshops aimed at achieving optimal health for people living with diabetes, overweight or gluten sensitivity. Dental health, landlord/tenant law, navigating public transit and yoga and meditation are topics covered in groups learning sessions. Email Alicia at volunteer@projectshare.ca for further information.      Canadian Tire Jumpstart and Bob Gale Recreation Fund - provides funding for children and adults who would be financially unable to participate in organized sports and culture. For more information call Joseph at 905-357-5121 ext 30.
Hours: Office Mon-Fri 8:30 am-4:30 pm * Client Services Mon-Thu 9:30 am-3:30 pm, Fri 9:30 am-12:30 pm
Eligibility: All, Living below poverty line stated by Statistics Canada and a resident of Niagara Falls.
Events: Please visit the website for event listings.
Primary Contact: Pam Sharp, Community Development Coordinator; Phone: 905-357-5121 ext 33; Email: development@projectshare.ca
Alternate Contact: Diane Corkum, Operations Director; Phone: 905-357-5121 ext 22; Email: diane.co@projectshare.ca
Volunteer Coordinator: Alicia Yap, Volunteer Coordinator; Phone: 905-357-5121 ext 24; Email: volunteer@projectshare.ca

Alternate Executive: Brian Pellow, Chair; Phone: 905-357-6577; Email: bpellow@cogeco.ca
Address: 4129 Stanley Ave, Unit 2Niagara Falls, ON     L2E 7H3 View Google Map
Intersection: Stanley Ave and Thorold Stone Rd
Funding: Regional / Municipal - Municipality of Niagara ; Federal - HRSDC;Trillium Foundation ; United Way - Niagara Falls

Name: Salvation Army Community and Family Services
Description (Service): The Community Services of the Salvation Army may be able to provide assistance with emergency food, clothing, and furniture assistance.  Offer:  * Anger Management courses * Christmas Hamper program * Summer Camp *  Referrals * Summer Camps for single moms and their children, and children aged 7-16, * Red Cap,* Niagara Mobile Outreach  Street Outreach Truck provides food, counselling and referrals for those in need. Please check out the blog at Niagara Mobile Outreach - Scheduled Stops or call the office for scheduled times.
Hours: Office Mon-Fri 9:00 am-4:30 pm * Food Bank Tue-Thu 9:30 am-12 noon
Dates: All year (closed Christmas Day to New Years)
Areas Served: Lincoln ; Niagara-on-the-Lake ; St Catharines ; Thorold ; West Lincoln
Application: Anyone interested in programs can inquire through the telephone number. Referrals are taken from other community services, community members and self referrals
Primary Contact: Carrie McComb, Community Outreach Program Supervisor; Email: Carrie_McComb@can.salvationarmy.org
Alternate Contact: Vi Callahan, Family Service Worker; Email: vcallahan@bellnet.ca
Primary Executive: Bev Moore, Family Services Director; Email: beverly_moore@can.salvationarmy.org
Address: 406 Niagara StSt Catharines, ON     L2M 7N5 View Google Map
Accessibility: Not Accessible - Able to meet with individuals at our church which is located right across the parking lot

Name: Salvation Army Community and Family Services
Description (Service): The Salvation Army will provide assistance to those in need. Clothing and furniture is provided to singles and families on a priority basis when available. Emergency Food assistance is provided 6 times a year per household. A listening ear is always available.  WORSHIP SERVICE - held Sundays at 10:30 am. MESSY CHURCH - a fun family group based on creativity, hospitality and celebration MUSIC, ART AND DRAMA - arts group for children  SANTA ANONYMOUS - where individuals can donate toys at barrels located at various businesses and Fire Stations throughout the city as well as at the Salvation Army on Dorchester. Registration - to receive food and/or toys, individuals must register (with proper documents) in person. Starting November 17. SANTA BREAKFAST - Great chance for the kids to enjoy a free breakfast and meet Santa on Saturday December 5, 2015. Please call 905-358-8394 for tickets. ANGER MANAGEMENT - a program available to all who are interested. The program runs for four consecutive Wednesdays, and will help all present understand anger, and more effectively deal with their emotional life and conflict situations where anger often arises. A certificate is received upon successful completion of the course. Please call for more details.  RED CAP (CHILDREN'S ANGER MANAGEMENT) - an anger management program for Children ages 9-13. Held in various schools in Niagara Falls. SUMMER CAMP - every summer the organization sends a limited number of children to the summer camp program. The camp is usually in Jul or Aug and is open to qualified applicants. Please call for details. "GIVE A KID A COAT" Program - Individuals can drop off coats at the local fire stations. Collection of coats, mittens, scarves, will be accepted. Distribution: Tue and Thu from 9:30 am-3 pm. Contact Lt. Jason or Kristen Dockeray for more information.  DONATIONS - Food donations accepted at 5720 Dorchester Rd or Thrift Store at 4420 Drummond Road.  Monetary Donations accepted 5720 Dorchester Rd or Thrift Store. STREET OUTREACH TRUCK provides food, counselling and referrals for those in need. Please check out the blog at Niagara Mobile Outreach or call the office for scheduled times.
Hours: Office Tue-Fri 9 am-4 pm * Food Bank Tue 1-4 by appointment * Worship Service Sun 10:30 am * Messy Church Third Fri of the month 6 pm * Music, Art and Drama Tue 5:30 pm-7 pm
Application: Santa Anonymous - register in person with proof of rent, income and ID on every one is required.
Primary Contact: Jason Dockeray, Pastor/Corps Officer; Phone:  * 905-351-0686; Email: jason_dockeray@can.salvationarmy.org
Alternate Contact: Natalie Beres, Administrative Assistant; Email: natalie_beres@can.salvationarmy.org
Primary Executive: Kristen Jackson-Dockeray, Pastor/Corps Officer; Phone:  * 905-351-3590; Email: kristen_dockeray@can.salvationarmy.org
Address: 5720 Dorchester RdNiagara Falls, ON     L2G 5S3 View Google Map

Hours: Administrative Mon-Fri 9 am-4:30 pm * Food Bank Tue-Thu 9:30 am-1 pm, Fri 9:30 am-12 noon

Name: Salvation Army Community and Family Services
Description (Service): A community-based service offering an emergency food bank * also assists with clothing and furniture in some situations and according to availability  Niagara Mobile Outreach Program  Utility Assistance - When clients are unable to pay arrears on utilities (Gas, Hydro and Water) * provides assistance in the form of grants which assist the client in bringing their bills back into good standing while at the same time encouraging personal fiscal responsibility  Monthly Community Lunches - Through an existing partnership with a local church offers a large meal on the second Saturday of each month feeding between 100-150 individuals (11 am at 255 Gilmore Rd)  Food Bank - Clients can come for assistance once a calendar month as well as any Monday, Wednesday and Friday (12 noon-4 pm) for bread and pizza  Christmas Assistance - Assists with food for the family and gifts for children  Emergency Disaster Services -  A team of individuals trained and prepared to be deployed at a moment's notice to provide emergency disaster assistance locally or throughout North America   Tax Clinics  - Assisting low income families and individuals complete simple returns  Ontario Early Years visits Thursday 9:30 am-12 noon
Hours: Office: Mon-Fri 9 am-4 pm * Food Bank: Mon, Wed, Fri 12 noon-4 pm * Mobile Outreach: visit website for details * Utility Assistance: By appointment
Areas Served: Crystal Beach ; Fort Erie ; Ridgeway ; Stevensville
Fees: Fees for some programs, call for details
Primary Contact: Elliott Innes, Community and Family Services Manager
Primary Executive: Greg Warkentin, Executive Director, The Salvation Army, Niagara Region; Phone: 905-735-5700; Email: greg_warkentin@can.salvationarmy.org
Address: 255 Gilmore RdFort Erie, ON     L2A 2M4 View Google Map

Name: West Lincoln Community Care
Description (Service): A non-profit, charitable organization that enhances the quality of life for members of the community who seek assistance and support.    Offers: * food * clothing * emergency assistance and a variety of programs for needy families and individuals in West Lincoln  Programs include: * income tax program (mainly held from Feb-Apr. May be able to accommodate other dates. Call for information).  * back-pack program * new mom program - new moms in need may be eligible for a baby gift basket including baby clothing, diapers, formula, food, bottles, blankets etc. * kids sports program - funding towards sport registration for children in low income families * Christmas program * emergency funding * utility funding - administers NEEF and LEAP programs and may have limited funds for water bills on a case by case basis * vouchers for clothing or household items * resource materials * referrals for personal counselling.
Hours: Food Bank Hours: Tue 9:30 am - 3 pm, Wed 3-7 pm, Thu 9:30 am - 5 pm.
Eligibility: Must be a resident of West Lincoln to register. All in particular need.  Usually recommended by Social Services.
Application: Need to show: * ID * Proof of residence * Financial expenses and income
Primary Contact: Garry Warden, Program Manager
Alternate Contact: Jody Young, Operations Manager; Email: wlccoperations@bellnet.ca
Address: 2660 Industrial Park RdSmithville, ON     L0R 2A0
Intersection: Industrial Park Rd and Skyway Rd

Name: Brock University
Public Comments: In order to choose an extension press 1 at the beginning of the automated menu.
Description (Service): Provides support services for sexual assault survivors and their family and friends * Targeted towards students and youth at Brock, Niagara College, and local high schools   Services include:  24 Hour Texting Support Line * Immediate crisis support and intervention, options, information, and referrals * All text messages are returned within 30 minutes * Anyone wishing to receive phone support can text using their name (real or fake name) and a number for reaching them  Advocacy * Advocates on behalf of clients -- may include accompaniments to the doctor's or hospital, help with Brock administration, etc * Advocacy services can be accessed by emailing, texting support line, or calling business line  Drop-in Support *support for anything needed - may include emotional support, financial/practical support, referrals or just a safe place to relax and hang out  Peer support * support can be long-term (weekly) or a single session -- offers phone, email, text and in-person support * completely anonymous support available --  text or email and an email account and password will be sent for client's use   Court Support * provides court information, court preparation and accompaniment/support throughout process  Public Education * educating for social change and raising awareness around issues of sexual violence at Brock * public education workshops available on wide range of topics for various audiences  Urgent Needs Cupboard and Fund * provides a safe and anonymous way for survivors of sexual violence to get food, bus tickets, toiletries, blankets, clothing and other requested items
Hours: Mon-Sun 24 hours * Drop-in Support Thu 12 noon-5 pm, other times by appointment
Eligibility: Services open to all survivors of sexual violence, as well as their family and friends
Application: For appointments call 905-397-7671, text 289-990-7233 or email Support@ASaferBrock.org
Crisis Phone: 24 hour Crisis and Support Text Line 289-990-7233 (289-990-SAFE)
Intersection: Ontario St and St Paul St
Accessibility: Partially Accessible - Parking - Accessible; Entrance (in back) - Accessible ; Please indicate your needs when booking an appointment and proper accommodations will be made. Appointments can be scheduled at the office at Brock University which is fully accessible.

Name: Society of St Vincent de Paul - St Catharines Central Council
Description (Service): The St Vincent de Paul is a fund that is associated with churches of the Catholic faith.  Donations are gathered at all church Masses and may be accessed by the public for food, vouchers and clothing in emergency situations.  The Society of St Vincent de Paul does not actually have an office location.  For residents of Niagara Falls – call 905-374-7070.  For residents of the Western Hill area in St Catharines, call 905-980-0925.   For residents of other areas in the Niagara Region, they would need to contact their closest Catholic church. To find which church is nearest go to Society of St Vincent de Paul, Ontario Regional Council and enter a postal code
Hours: Call for details
Application: Call for information. If you are asked to leave a message, be sure to leave a name, phone number and address so that`someone can return your call.
Accessibility: Unknown - Varies by location. Call individual churches for more information.

Description (Service): Drop in Centre:  Phone(free long distance to Canada and USA) and Internet  Food bank and clothing depot available to area residents on low income (proof of income and address necessary). Also offering individual and family Christian counselling/ addictions counselling.  Will  also provide the following:  * funeral services for low income individuals * visits for shut-ins and inmates;  * advocacy for workers compensation, housing and programs including Ontario Works and Ontario Disability. * Income tax preparation for low income individuals and families

Name: Westview Centre4Women
Description (Service): A weekly drop-in centre, providing women of all walks of life with a safe, welcoming and dignified environment. The centre fosters a non-judgmental environment that accepts women exactly the way they are and provides a space for them to meet friends from the past and make new friends for the future.  Provides practical services and assistance to women who would like it. Free services include: clothing exchange/closet; clothing alterations; shampoo and haircuts; coffee, snacks and a hot lunch; monthly craft corner; special events; access to a telephone; play corner for pre-school children (parent supervised). The Plentiful Pantry provides small portion food items and household products at a suggested small donation.
Hours: Tue-Thu 10 am-4 pm
Events: Yearly retreat, evening Bingos Christmas Party Annual Unity in the Community event
Primary Contact: Erika Klassen, Community Outreach Pastor; Phone: 905 687 4848; Email: director@westviewc4w.com

Address: 124 Queenston StSt Catharines, ON     L2R 2Z7

Name: South Niagara Life Ministries
Description (Service): A resource centre providing counselling to men, women, teens, youth, couples, individuals, and families; on a short or long term basis; Emergency and crisis assistance (drop-in inquiries welcome). Counselling includes: * Anger resolution * Losses * Marriage * Parenting * Relationship and conflict resolution * Addictions * Abuse * Emotional upsets  Also Offers * Advocacy * Biblical Services and Programs * Budgeting: Earn As You Learn Lifeskill classes * Food bank and clothing resources for clientele or one time emergency assistance;  * Unplanned Pregnancy Resources: On-site pregnancy testing, Decision Making Program, Pre/Postnatal assistance, Parenting programs, Post Adoption, Post Abortion Grief counselling.  Vision: Helping People Resolve Life Crisis, Issues, and Problems  Contact site located at 72 Charlotte St, Port Colborne. Call for details
Hours: Fort Erie Mon-Fri 9 am-5 pm * Port Colborne Wed 1:30 pm-4:30 pm
Fees: None ; Occasional cost of study materials
Primary Contact: Martha Beroud, Executive Director
Address: 143 Gilmore RdFort Erie, ON     L2A 2L9 View Google Map
Accessibility: Partially Accessible - Parking - Usable; Entrance - Usable; Washroom - Accessible
Funding: Fundraising ; Donations - Careholders, churches, individuals & businesses
Print Material: Newsletter - South Niagara Life Ministries Brochures

Name: Port Cares
Description (Service): Provide a wide range of services on an individual case basis including:  * advocacy * assistance with domestic abuse situations * addictions * emergency food * utilities * crisis situations *  transportation *  may offer financial assistance for emergency medical need *  offer referrals for education and employment.  The Housing Help services includes: * information for landlords and tenants * assisting clients and landlords with housing clients * supports in maintaining housing and Transitional Housing Moving Forward  * Program and information on Rights and Responsibilities of landlords and tenants.   Serves as the local agent for the: * Canadian Tire Jumpstart Program * Winter Warmth Program and Niagara Energy Emergency Fund (NEEF).   Client Services services:   * Koats for Kids * Income Tax Clinics * Give a Gift, Adopt-A-Family at Christmas * Back Packs for Back to School.   Offers confidential one-on-one service to clients and refer when required. All services are free of charge.
Hours: Mon-Thu 9 am-3 pm, Fri 9 am-12 noon
Application: Registration or application for some services  * Call for information
Events: Koats for Kids (And Adults too!) To Donate a Coat: Drop off gently used coats at Lightheart's Dry Cleaners, 338 King St, Port Colborne in Oct  To Receive a Coat: Coats and winter clothing are distributed through our Reach Out Centre at 61 Nickel St.in the fall and winter. call 905-835-1914 for more information.
Primary Contact: Sarah Eller, Manager of Client Services and Reach Out Centre; Phone: 905-835-1914
Primary Executive: Christine Clark Lafleur, Executive Director; Phone: ext 248; Email: christine.clark-lafleur@portcares.ca
Address: 92 Charlotte StPort Colborne, ON     L3K 3E1 View Google Map
Funding: Regional / Municipal - Region of Niagara ; Fundraising ; Donations ; United Way - South Niagara

Name: Grimsby Benevolent Fund
Description (Service): A non profit organization providing food, clothing, furniture, houseware,  Christmas hampers,limited utility assistance to low income residents in Grimsby and surrounding areas.
Hours: Store Mon-Thu, Sat 10 am-4:30 pm, Fri 10 am-8 pm * Food Bank Mon-Fri 10 am-2 pm
Primary Contact: Stacy Elia, Executive Director; Phone: 905-309-5664 ext 33
Address: 40 Elm StGrimsby, ON     L3M 4G3 View Google Map
Intersection: Main St E and Elm St

Name: First Baptist Church Thorold
Description (Service): A local parish offering services in the Baptist faith. Offers a nursery and Sunday School program for children (11 and under) during worship services and bible study when possible.  Also offers a free Community Supper and Lunch. Runs a Food Pantry for those in need.
Hours: Office Call for information * Services Sun 10:30 am * Community Supper Third Fri of the month 5 pm-7 pm * Community Lunch from Mon 12 noon-1 pm Jan-Mar, First Mon of month 12 noon-1 pm Apr-Dec * Food Panty Call for information
Primary Contact: Rob Kamerman, Pastor
Address: 42 Ormond St SThorold, ON     L2V 1Y4 View Google Map

Name: St Alfred's Roman Catholic Church
Description (Service): A local church offering services in the Roman Catholic faith. Offers Children's Liturgy for children 4-10yrs during 10:30 am Sunday Mass. Through the Society of St Vincent de Paul, also offers a food bank Mon-Fri from 9-11am for anyone who lives in the parish geography (does not have to be Catholic).
Hours: Office Mon-Fri 9 am-4:30 pm * Masses Sat 6 pm, Sun 7:45 am, 9 am (Italian), 10:30 am, 12 noon * Sat 7:30 pm (Spanish)
Boundaries: North of the QEW to Lake Ontario, East of Geneva St to the Canal.
Eligibility: Church - All Food Bank - picture ID (e.g. Driver's License), a piece of mail that is addressed to you at your address (to prove location of residence)
Volunteer Coordinator: Denise Kelly, Chair, Society of St Vincent De Paul
Address: 272 Vine StSt Catharines, ON     L2M 4T3 View Google Map

Name: Holy Trinity Anglican Church
Description (Service): Offers ministry and Anglican worship in a traditional setting.  Holy Trinity Food and Hygiene Pantry offers food, baby necessities, shampoo, laundry detergent, toilet paper, deodorant and other personal care items. Upon registration, clients will be given a 'points card' and each item has a  point amount for ‘shopping’.  Clients are asked to use the Market Square entrance to access the pantry. Donations are always welcome and can be dropped off at the church office.
Hours: Office Tue-Wed 8 am-2 pm, Fri 8 am-12 noon * Services Sun 8 am, 10 am * Wed 12 noon * Food and Hygiene Pantry Third Thu of the month 4 pm-6 pm
Application: Call or walk in for service
Primary Contact: Rev William Alakas, Rector
Address: 77 Division StWelland, ON     L3B 3Z8 View Google Map
